title: Chapter 1: Ten Principles of Economics
icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="h-8 w-8" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" d="M19 11H5m14 0a2 2 0 012 2v6a2 2 0 01-2 2H5a2 2 0 01-2-2v-6a2 2 0 012-2m14 0V9a2 2 0 00-2-2M5 11V9a2 2 0 012-2m0 0V5a2 2 0 012-2h6a2 2 0 012 2v2M7 7h10" /></svg>

questions.question: The English word that comes from the Greek word for "one who manages a household" is
The word "economy" comes from the Greek word oikonomos, which means
Resources are
options: a. scarce for households but plentiful for economies.
b. plentiful for households but scarce for economies.
c. scarce for households and scarce for economies.
d. plentiful for households and plentiful for economies.
questions.answer: c. scarce for households and scarce for economies.

questions.question: In considering how to allocate its scarce resources among its various members, a household considers
Economics deals primarily with the concept of
Which of the following is correct?
options: a. The word economy comes from the Greek word for "rational thinker."
b. Economists study the management of scarce resources.
c. Because economists believe that people pursue their best interests, they are not interested in how people interact.
d. All of the above are correct.
questions.answer: b. Economists study the management of scarce resources.

questions.question: The overriding reason why households and societies face many decisions is that
options: b. goods and services are not scarce.
c. incomes fluctuate with business cycles.
d. people, by nature, tend to disagree.

questions.question: The phenomenon of scarcity stems from the fact that
options: a. most economies' production methods are not very good.
b. in most economies, wealthy people consume disproportionate quantities of goods and services.
c. governments restrict production of too many goods and services.

questions.question: Approximately what percentage of the world's economies experience scarcity?
When a society cannot produce all the goods and services people wish to have, it is said that the economy is experiencing
Which of the following products would be considered scarce?
options: b. baseballs autographed by Babe Ruth
d. All of the above are correct.
questions.answer: d. All of the above are correct.

questions.question: Economics is the study of
options: b. how society manages its scarce resources.
c. how households decide who performs which tasks.
d. the interaction of business and government.
questions.answer: b. how society manages its scarce resources.

questions.question: In most societies, resources are allocated by
options: b. a small number of central planners.
c. those firms that use resources to provide goods and services.
d. the combined actions of millions of households and firms.
questions.answer: d. the combined actions of millions of households and firms.

questions.question: Oil is considered to be a non-renewable energy source. Oil
options: c. is not a productive resource.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an example of scarcity?
options: a. Only some people can afford to buy a Ferrari.
b. Every individual in society cannot attain the highest standard of living to which he or she might aspire.
c. Doug has an unlimited supply of apples in his orchard.
d. Each member of a household cannot get everything he or she wants.
questions.answer: c. Doug has an unlimited supply of apples in his orchard.

questions.question: Which of the following is a decision that economists study?
options: c. how much money people save
d. All of the above are correct.
questions.answer: d. All of the above are correct.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of something economists study?
options: a. Kate chooses to work overtime to earn extra income for her family.
b. Ryan sells his economics textbook from last semester to his roommate for half the price of a new textbook.
c. The unemployment rate in the United States is at its highest level in over fifty years.
d. All of the above are correct.
questions.answer: d. All of the above are correct.
